meanings.definition: In a way that involves great danger or risk.
meanings.sent1: She walked perilously close to the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent2: The hiker balanced perilously on the narrow mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The cat teetered perilously on the top of the fence, trying to impress the birds.
meanings.sent4: His grades were perilously low, hanging on the edge of failure.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter climbed perilously up the burning building to save the trapped family.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is extremely hazardous or unsafe.
meanings.sent1: The driver sped perilously through the red light.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat swung perilously high above the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chef juggled knives perilously close to his fingers, much to the audience's nervous laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her health deteriorated perilously fast, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The tightrope walker moved perilously across the thin rope, captivating the spectators.
